   As you might have noticed already, the clAss release of this game is 
   another obvious beta - just like the Evil-iso from which they ripped
   it. A few examples of the differences between CLS beta and storefinal
   (there are too many to list them all, we included full dirlists for
   your convenience in the first zip).
   
   CLS/EVILISO:
    
   00.03.01  18:47:00   1,556,574  F1_2000.ICD
   00.02.28  19:00:14   3,995,696  Season00TracksMagny-Coursmgca.mas
   00.02.28  19:00:14      92,630  Season00TracksMagny-Coursmgca1.scn
   00.02.20  15:45:36     171,977  Season00TracksMonzamond.aiw
   00.02.25  21:33:52   1,990,220  Season00VehiclesFerrariTEAM.MAS
   
   Our storefinal:
  
   00.03.09  11:14:40   1,560,670  F1_2000.ICD
   00.03.05  20:49:40   4,021,680  Season00TracksMagny-Coursmgca.mas
   00.03.05  20:49:40      94,262  Season00TracksMagny-Coursmgca1.scn
   00.03.07  17:44:26     154,916  Season00TracksMonzamond.aiw  
   00.03.03  23:39:58   1,990,224  Season00VehiclesFerrariTEAM.MAS
  
   The most obvious difference is of course the version number of the game,
   that even CLS gimps should be able to see in the file properties: 
   
   CLS     v0.915
   Final   v1.04
  
  
   GAME NOTES:
  
   Dive into the game and the first thing you'll notice is that F1 2000's
   engine is already looking extremely sumptuous, with some simply
   superb looking cars and circuits. Every track from the 2000 season has 
   been modelled in immaculate detail using official photography and track
   data to exactly reproduce all the twists and nuances of each circuit,
   even down to tiny details like the famous graffiti at Imola.
  
   F1 2000's cars are equally detailed, with full and authentic liveries,
   helmet styles and insignia, separate car monocoques and up to 1200 
   polygons per car (depending on team and model). The viewing system is 
   impressive, with full TV-style race coverage courtesy of up to 16 
   different internal and external camera views, fully working wing mirrors
   and the ability to zoom in and even see the driver's eyes move as they 
   anticipate the next tricky corner. Graphically it's extremely difficult 
   to fault - and on a high-end machine, combines a very real impression of
   breakneck speed with a near photo-realistic quality driving experience. 
  
   GAME FEATURES:
   
   -All the real cars, drivers and tracks from the FIA Formula One
    World Championship
   
   -Photo-realistic cars and tracks
   
   -23 individual camera views
   
   -Full 3-D virtual cockpit
   
   -6-D physics. Cars can roll and tumble in all directions, not rooted
    to the track.
  
   -Real shadows, skid marks that remain for a full race weekend, smoke and
    dust effects
  
   -Individually modelled cars
  
   -Car performance based on real F1 data
  
   -Pit-to-car radio
  
   -Full car set-up and driver assistance options
  
   -Real F1 rules
  
   -Pre and Post Race presentation by ITV's Jim Rosenthal
  
   -Full race replay &amp; highlights
  
   Ripped: movies and menu music.

   Unzip and unace either manually or with our installer. Run SETUP.BAT to
   unpack the gfx files. After that is done, setup your hardware with
   F1_Config.exe.
  
   You can start the game then with F1_2000.EXE.
